think_procedure: 1. Identify the knob 'synchronous_commit' in PostgreSQL. 2. Research the behavior of 'synchronous_commit' to determine if it has any special values that alter its functionality significantly. 3. Discover that 'synchronous_commit' can be set to 'off' as a special value, which changes its behavior to not wait for the transaction to be written to disk before returning, unlike its regular operation. 4. Conclude that 'synchronous_commit' is a special knob due to this behavior change when set to 'off'.
